body: @openzipkin/ui anyone have some time to contribute? This should be an easier one
There's probably an overlap with https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/2291 which says to scroll instead of wrap, but i'll let the UX guys do the debate on that.

As of Zipkin 2.21, trace archiving is now supported: https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-server#trace-archival . 

In the screenshot below you can see the 'Archive Trace' button appearing once everything is configured:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/79041723-3897dc80-7bf2-11ea-877d-1720f827b740.png)

Note there is an ongoing discussion whether queries [should fan out to archival instances](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/3023).

TLS errors are now shown properly in the `health` endpoint:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/79042297-c5dd3000-7bf6-11ea-9158-91c72f435b5f.png)

Have a look at [in-process tracing](https://github.com/openzipkin/brave/tree/master/brave#in-process-tracing) .

Feel free to drop by on the gitter channel for more questions if this is not clear.
@halower feel free to hop on over on our [gitter](https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin) channel if you have more questions like this.
I'll update unit tests using TypeScript.

Thank you for your report.
I fixed this bug in #3061 .
@tacigar thanks, looks good to me. Do you think anything could (should) be done for the service names in the trace diagram itself ?

Yes, I know the problem, but I haven't fixed it yet.

Currently this trace diagram written by SVG.
Since SVG is not good at wrapping text and doing text ellipsis, I am thinking of re-implementing the trace diagram with regular html tags instead of SVG.
Regular html can style with powerful css.

I'll do it as soon as possible.

FYI: This is a PR that tried to solve this problem before. (I once merged it by mistake, but soon reverted ...) https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/2949
Thanks so much @hanahmily as well @anuraaga and @jorgheymans for review!
@adriancole , @anuraaga and @jorgheymans Thanks a lot for helping me review this. I really learn a lot from you.

This is an older issue relating to zipkin classic. Nevertheless i verified that Lens, the new UI, is able to handle such spans and it does. I took the yelp test trace https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-lens/testdata/yelp.json and modified both mysql spans to have no parent. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/79500161-4f906180-802c-11ea-850f-3ae96d931fbe.png)

In any case, tracing over messaging systems is very well supported in brave nowadays so it would be more natural to let the trace continue over the broker into the consumer.
Thrift has drifted away to greener pastures, closing.
issue was discussed, became inactive, was added to todo list then 2 years later removed from todo list ... So I'll close this one if anyone objects feel free to reopen.

@jhonatanforero have you tried using more recent versions of Lens, I just tested this using 2.21.1 and tag data is not truncated:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/79697801-143c9f80-8285-11ea-87b3-8a08463d169f.png)

Trace with huge tag data here : [huge-tag.txt](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/files/4500008/yep-huge-tag.txt)

I also tested using tag data 5 times bigger than the one posted above, the tag column scrolls along nicely. 

Also, for downloading the tag data you can download the complete json of the trace and extract it from there:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/79698220-cffece80-8287-11ea-9d73-5ff3e739354d.png)

@anuraaga I checked this and `TRACK` is indeed still disallowed whereas `TRACE` is. Maybe there's an easy toggle in Armeria to disallow this ? 

```
$ curl -i -X TRACE http://localhost:9411/zipkin
HTTP/1.1 302 Found
location: /zipkin/
content-length: 0
server: Armeria/0.99.3
date: Sun, 19 Apr 2020 20:43:36 GMT

$ curl -i -X TRACK http://localhost:9411/zipkin
HTTP/1.1 405 Method Not Allowed
content-type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
content-length: 41
server: Armeria/0.99.3
date: Sun, 19 Apr 2020 20:43:40 GMT

405 Method Not Allowed
Unsupported method
```
@javigomez Lens is now the default UI, the 'Try Lens UI' button has been removed so this should no longer be problem. OK to close this issue ?

Yup should be pretty simple so will add the tweak. For reference, there isn't really a security vulnerability since we don't "actually implement TRACE", which would involve returning the request headers in the response, we just return what we would have on a GET. So no rush to release a patch IMO.
@tacigar Let me go ahead and merge this, happy to move things around later as makes sense :)
PTAL

@tacigar Do you normally use `yarn` or `npm` for development, e.g. at LINE? I always use `yarn` and while using `npm` here doesn't quite bother me, it does have some quirks for some of my workflows. If you and I are both more accustomed to `yarn` I think that's good reason to switch :) If not, will stick to `npm`.

Yes, no problem!
Thank you!

if there's no strong opinions counter, yarn is also helpful for workflow consistency with zipkin-js. Some of us don't work in javascript too much, and it is helpful to have a consistent flow across our projects.

v2 format made this far less hairy than before. in v1 you could have like 4 different names in the same span!

in Lens, the pagination notion no longer exists :

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/80279258-9d782a00-86fc-11ea-8966-da106e6a3395.png)

having looked a bit at this, the simplest no-code way to generate a jdiff report between 2 arbitrary zipkin versions is (thanks to our friends over at https://github.com/zolyfarkas/spf4j/) : 

```
$ wget https://search.maven.org/remotecontent?filepath=org/spf4j/spf4j-jdiff-maven-plugin/8.8.1/spf4j-jdiff-maven-plugin-8.8.1-uber.jar -O jdiff.jar
$ java -jar jdiff.jar -gId io.zipkin.zipkin2 -aId zipkin \
-fromVersion 2.10.0 -toVersion 2.15.0 \
-o . \
-p 'zipkin2 zipkin2.storage zipkin2.codec zipkin2.v1'
```

Only thing i had to do is hardcode the packages to include because it does not have an exclude option to handle `zipkin2.internal`. I figured this is ok because this really is not a volatile package structure.

If we agree this is a good way to proceed we should hook this into the release process somehow, publish the result and make it available somewhere off `README.md` 

For reference, [here](https://github.com/google/guava/blob/gh-pages/updaterelease.sh) is how guava does it - slightly more involved.

- small bleed-through issue on FF (Ubuntu)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/80994935-bf308a00-8e3d-11ea-9fe1-1328f3c4dfc9.png)
- when the first element in the search bar is the `spanName` then there is no auto complete, I guess this is because there are too many spanNames and we can't load them all ? In any case, users are going to be confused
- funny behaviour:
![lens](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/193792/80996374-fd2ead80-8e3f-11ea-844c-212e4e4794dc.gif)

@jorgheymans Thank you for your review! > * small bleed-through issue on FF (Ubuntu) Fixed! > * when the first element in the search bar is the spanName then there is no auto complete, I guess this is because there are too many spanNames and we can't load them all ? In any case, users are going to be confused A service name must be specified to load span name suggestions. https://zipkin.io/zipkin-api/#/default/get_spans But as you said, current behavior may be confusing to users. I have 2 solutions in mind. * Leave the behavior as it is and display a friendly manual somewhere. * Disable the selection of span name or remote service name before the service name is selected. WDYT? > * funny behaviour: Fixed the behavior. ![search](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19551419/81126360-0326aa80-8f76-11ea-8b02-8a96cf33f450.gif)

Finally, I will make a unit test of `CriterionBox`.
This will require checking out a variety of scenarios and will take some time.

Maybe this is not a bug.Zipkin gets service names through /services API,but only aggregation the laster 24h spans to get names.It sounds OK on most situations, but my test data is a month ago.I can set the lookback time through QUERY_LOOKBACK param,but it has a max value(less than a month).

If i understood the limitation correctly, Lens (the new Zipkin UI) does not have this problem. The default lookback period is 15 minutes and includes spans received in the same minute. This can be observed by starting zipkin with self tracing enabled, `--zipkin.self-tracing.enabled=true`, then refreshing the screen a few times and clicking on the search button without changing any of the default time criteria. The result is that all the traces that were just generated seconds before show up on the screen.

This is actually covered by specific tests in [CassandraStorageTest](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/f238246b30ffae0e52b8323e3547a0d97b9aef0c/zipkin-storage/cassandra/src/test/java/zipkin2/storage/cassandra/CassandraStorageTest.java#L39) , [CassandraStorageTest.v1](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/f238246b30ffae0e52b8323e3547a0d97b9aef0c/zipkin-storage/cassandra-v1/src/test/java/zipkin2/storage/cassandra/v1/CassandraStorageTest.java#L28), [ElasticsearchStorageTest](https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/10c478ba049696e9ef32e8400a3d7209e3f31c5a/zipkin-storage/elasticsearch/src/test/java/zipkin2/elasticsearch/ElasticsearchStorageTest.java#L196), and InMemoryStorageTest was aligned to this in https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3085 which will close this issue once merged.
